Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Early On Michigan, Build Up Michigan

See the link in the Support Material section at the end of this section to identify a direct link to these statewide services.

  • Offers Early Intervention Services

    If a child appears to be experiencing a delay and the parent or guardian wants to know where they can go for help, where do you refer them? Children, birth to 3 should be referred to Early ON. Those 3 to 5 should be referred to Build Up Michigan. These are resources in Michigan that provide free services to families. If a concern is presented, they will do the appropriate evaluation.

  • Provides Free Evaluation & Recommended Services

    If a 50% or greater delay is identified in one or more areas of development, or a child has a pre-existing condition, the child will be enrolled in the Early On or Build Up Michigan program. A service coordinator will work with the family to ensure that the child gets the services that he or she needs. Specialists will be assigned to support. They could be early intervention teachers, physical, occupational, speech therapists, or nurses.

  • Resources in Other Languages

    They have several resources available in Spanish.

  • Research Shows Advantage of Early Interventions

    Research has shown that addressing a child’s delays early can effectively impact the child’s development, even into adulthood.

  • How To Contact Early On Michigan

    For children birth to 3, parents or guardians should call 1-800-Early-On or bring up the website at 1800earlyon.org to make a referral.

  • How To Contact Build Up Michigan

    For children 3-5 parents should contact Build Up Michigan at buildupmi.org or 1-888-320-8384.
